results.title: Breath death: a tragedy in masks
results.creator_credit: S. Vanderbeek and A Visible Fill'm
results.brief_description: An anti-war collage composed of fleeting black and white visual using a variety of animation techniques. The tone of this experimental film is surreal using sources of images and sounds from the 20th Century, opening with the rhythm from Screamin’ Jay Hawkins’ ‘I Put a Spell on You’. Soundtrack by Jay Watt.

results.title: Breast stroke
results.creator_credit: Rick Pepin, Dan Ryan and Aquaforum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
One of a series of films showing various swimmers demonstrating their swimming styles. This film concentrates on breaststroke swimmers.

results.title: Breast self-examination [revised version]
results.brief_description: An updated and revised version of the film “Breast self examination” (Title code 309812) encouraging women to adopt a simple method of breast self-examination as a regular health habit. Explains that if breast cancer was suspected earlier by women themselves, 80% of patients could be saved by surgery.

results.title: Breast cancer: the problem of early diagnosis (D)
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: Emphasises importance of early, accurate diagnosis and effective treatment of disease. Many deaths can be prevented because (1) modern treatment cures most early breast cancers, and (2) early diagnosis is favoured by accessibility of this site to examination. Normal growth and development of breasts described; chemical pathology of breast cancer; techniques of breast examination. WARNING: CONTAINS GRAPHIC DEPICTIONS OF BREAST CANCER

results.title: Breakthrough to literacy
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates and London, Midland and Scottish Railway
results.brief_description: Explains the “Breakthrough” method of teaching children to read and write. Useful for parents and teachers and recommended for education discussion groups. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Breakthrough
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Victorian School for Deaf Children and Senior Films
results.brief_description: Education of deaf children in Victoria. At the Princess Elizabeth Kindergarten for the Deaf, very young children start the training which will fit them into a world of sound. Specially trained staff teach small groups by means of lip-reading, drawings and play-acting. Older children attend the St Kilda Road School, where, beside the ordinary curriculum, they learn domestic science, typing or a trade. Commentary by George Fairfax.

results.title: Breaking up
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)
results.brief_description: Using vignettes, still photos, interviews, and the New York landscape, this film follows the trials and tribulations of Steve (Russell Crowe) and Monica’s (Salma Hayek) tumultuous relationship that vacillates between being together, and breaking up. The two realise that they can’t live with each other, but can’t do without the other either and are trapped in a continuous process of breaking up then making up. Ultimately, they have to decide what it is that’s holding them together when the excitement of their renewed sexual attraction that occurs when they make up seems to be the overarching link between them. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Cristofer.
